name: Ratmen
background:
Ratmen are small humanoids, closely related to rats. Individually weak, they rely on large numbers of warriors, growth-serum injected beasts, and inventive war-machines. 

The Ratmen first emerged from the sewer systems beneath the Old Empire’s greatest cities, but were viewed as abominations by the humans and quickly driven out. Faced with many dangers and few friends, the Ratmen have become fanatical warriors and cunning tacticians, often serving as a buffer to the society that drove them out.
backgroundFull:
The Ratmen only started appearing long after humanity and their cities had become widespread throughout much of Tyria. Little is known about how or why they came into being, but they emerged from sewer systems beneath human cities. When their existence was discovered by the humans above, they were viewed as abominations and driven out of the cities. The surviving Ratmen sought refuge in neighbouring lands, but none were willing to accept them. 

The Ratmen eventually found a new home in a stretch of land that had been particularly devastated during the Havoc Wars. In the Northlands, surviving Havoc Warriors continued to raid and plunder, while the original Human inhabitants had mostly moved to the more defended southern regions. The Ratmen settled in these largely abandoned lands, and their numbers rapidly grew as they reclaimed the territory which had been left barren by years of brutal warfare. They rapidly built fortified cities, designed to withstand attack from raiders and any others who might try to claim the Ratmen’s land as their own.

For a time, the Ratmen prospered thanks to their diligent work and the region’s rich natural resources, and soon their society grew prosperous. Within their massive cities, they organised themselves into many guilds, each specialised in providing different benefits for their society, and their cities were ruled by commissions made up of the heads of the city’s key guilds. Yet, as Tyria continued to recover from the Havoc Wars, the Ratmen’s lands fell under increasing pressure from their various neighbours, who sought to reclaim it and forced the Ratmen to endure constant sieges and warfare in order to defend their home. 

The opening of the Rift was the fatal blow to their former society. The rift tore through several cities, destroying their walls, while the forces of Havoc rallied in the north. Panic spread and soon, and the various Guilds were fighting among themselves. 

Just as the forces of Havoc approached their lands, and all hope was lost, a miracle happened. A godly figure of a female rat appeared in the sky and struck down their enemies’ army. The remaining Rats renounced their quarrels and reunited to fight in the name of their mysterious new Goddess, creating a cult in her name that now occupies every corner of their society. Her disciples whisper in the ears of the guild masters, and while many see her as a saviour, others view her as a threat to their still delicate positions. 

How will you serve the Guilds and God-Mother?

spells.name: Magic Skitter-Step
spells.effect: Pick up to two friendly units within 12", which get Scurry Boost once (next time the effect would apply).

parameters.name: effectDuration
parameters.value: once (next time the effect would apply)

costFormula.value: { name: params.effect.unitRule.name, rating: params.effect.unitRule.rating, multiplier: params.multiplier * (params.aura ? this.AuraSize : 1), avgUnit: !params.thisUnit }

effectDuration.name: once (next time the effect would apply)

spells.name: Heavenly Strike
spells.effect: Pick up to two enemy units within 12", which take 1 hit with AP(2) each.

spells.name: God-Mother's Frenzy
spells.effect: Pick up to four friendly units within 12", which get Melee Slayer once (next time the effect would apply).

parameters.name: effectDuration
parameters.value: once (next time the effect would apply)

effectDuration.name: once (next time the effect would apply)

parameters.name: effectDuration
parameters.value: once (next time the effect would apply)

effectDuration.name: once (next time the effect would apply)

costFormula.value: params.thisUnit ? 0 : this.getUnitBaseCostDiff({ quality: 4, defense: 5, tough: 2, rules: ["Tough"] }, { defense: 5 - params.effect.rollModifier.value })

effectDuration.name: once (next time the effect would apply)

spells.name: Lightning Blast
spells.effect: Pick up to three enemy models within 12", which take 2 hits with Hazardous each. Roll as many dice as hits to see if "on rolls of 1" effects trigger.

parameters.name: spellHitRoll
parameters.value: Roll as many dice as hits to see if "on rolls of 1" effects trigger.

spellHitRoll.name: Roll as many dice as hits to see if "on rolls of 1" effects trigger.

specialRules.name: Hazardous
specialRules.description: Gets AP(4), but this model's unit takes one wound on unmodified rolls of 1 to hit.

specialRules.name: Stealth Aura
specialRules.description: This model and up to 3 friendly units picked before the start of the game get Stealth. If this model is killed, picked models that are deployed lose the rule.

specialRules.name: Quick Readjustment
specialRules.description: This model ignores penalties from shooting after moving when using Indirect weapons.

specialRules.name: Sergeant
specialRules.description: When this model attacks, unmodified results of 6 to hit deal 1 extra hit (only the original hit counts as a 6 for special rules).

specialRules.name: Unpredictable Fighter
specialRules.description: When in melee, roll one die and apply one effect to all models with this rule: on a 1-3 they get AP(+1), and on a 4-6 they get +1 to hit rolls instead.

specialRules.name: Unique
specialRules.description: This unit may only be taken once per army.

specialRules.name: Takedown Strike
specialRules.description: Once per game, when it's this model's turn to attack in melee, you may pick one model in the unit as its target, and make one attack at Quality 2+ with AP(2) and Deadly(3), which is resolved as if it's a unit of 1.

specialRules.name: Repel Ambushers
specialRules.description: Enemy units using Ambush must be set up over 12" away from this model's unit.

specialRules.name: Shielded
specialRules.description: Units where all models have this rule get +1 to defense rolls against hits that are not from spells.

specialRules.name: Precision Fighter Aura
specialRules.description: This model and up to 3 friendly units picked before the start of the game get +1 to hit rolls in melee. If this model is killed, picked models that are deployed lose the rule.

specialRules.name: Ambush Aura
specialRules.description: This model and up to 3 friendly units picked before the start of the game get Ambush. If this model is killed, picked models that are deployed lose the rule.

specialRules.name: Evasive Aura
specialRules.description: This model and up to 3 friendly units picked before the start of the game get Evasive. If this model is killed, picked models that are deployed lose the rule.

specialRules.name: Scurry
specialRules.description: Moves +2" when using Advance, and +2” when using Rush/Charge.

specialRules.name: Counter-Attack Aura
specialRules.description: This model and up to 3 friendly units picked before the start of the game get Counter-Attack. If this model is killed, picked models that are deployed lose the rule.

specialRules.name: Increased Shooting Range Aura
specialRules.description: This model and up to 3 friendly units picked before the start of the game get +6" range when shooting. If this model is killed, picked models that are deployed lose the rule.

specialRules.name: Defense Debuff
specialRules.description: Once per activation, before attacking, pick up to 4 enemy units within 18", which gets -1 to defense rolls once (next time the effect would apply).

specialRules.name: Bane when Shooting Aura
specialRules.description: This model and up to 3 friendly units picked before the start of the game get Bane when shooting. If this model is killed, picked models that are deployed lose the rule.

specialRules.name: Bane in Melee Aura
specialRules.description: This model and up to 3 friendly units picked before the start of the game get Bane in melee. If this model is killed, picked models that are deployed lose the rule.

specialRules.name: Scurry Boost Aura
specialRules.description: This model and up to 3 friendly units picked before the start of the game get Scurry Boost. If this model is killed, picked models that are deployed lose the rule.

specialRules.name: Reinforcement
specialRules.description: When a unit where all models have this rule is shaken or fully destroyed, you may remove it from the table as destroyed and place a new copy of it fully within 12" of any table edge at the beginning of the next round after Ambushers have been deployed. Units that deploy via Reinforcement can’t seize or contest objectives on the round they deploy, and this rule doesn’t apply to the new copy of the unit.

specialRules.name: AP
specialRules.description: Targets get -X to Defense rolls when blocking hits.

specialRules.name: Stealth
specialRules.description: When units where all models have this rule are shot from over 9" away, enemy units get -1 to hit rolls.

specialRules.name: Indirect
specialRules.description: Gets -1 to hit rolls when shooting after moving. May target enemies that are not in line of sight as if in line of sight, and ignores cover from sight obstructions.

specialRules.name: Deadly
specialRules.description: Assign each wound to one model, and multiply it by X. Hits from Deadly must be resolved first, and these wounds don’t carry over to other models if the original target is killed.

specialRules.name: Ambush
specialRules.description: May be set aside before deployment. At the start of any round after the first, may be deployed anywhere over 9” away from enemy units. Players alternate in placing Ambush units, starting with the player that activates next. Units that deploy via Ambush can’t seize or contest objectives on the round they deploy.

specialRules.name: Evasive
specialRules.description: Enemies get -1 to hit rolls when attacking units where all models have this rule.

specialRules.name: Counter-Attack
specialRules.description: Strikes first when charged.

specialRules.name: Counter
specialRules.description: Strikes first with this weapon when charged, and the charging unit gets -1 total Impact rolls per model with Counter.

specialRules.name: Bane
specialRules.description: Ignores Regeneration, and when attacking the target must re-roll unmodified Defense results of 6.

specialRules.name: Scurry Boost
specialRules.description: If this model has Scurry, it moves +4" on Advance and +4" on Rush/Charge from Scurry (instead of only +2" and +2").

specialRules.name: Melee Slayer
specialRules.description: This model's melee weapons get AP(+2) against units where most models have Tough(3) or higher.
